text: Alhassane Baldé (born 21 December 1985) is a Guinean-born German Paralympic athlete who competes in long-distance running events in international level events. Baldé was the second of twins. His disability was caused by a medical error at birth: he was pulled out of the womb in breech position resulting in an injured spine. He and his twin brother were adopted by his aunt and uncle moved to Düsseldorf aged nine months to receive medical treatment. ==References== Category:1985 births Category:Living people Category:Sportspeople from Bonn Category:Paralympic athletes of Germany Category:German male long-distance runners Category:German male wheelchair racers Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2004 Summer Paralympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2008 Summer Paralympics Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 2016 Summer Paralympics
title: Alhassane Baldé
